text.text_translated:
Are things bad every day? Is progress impossible?
Steven Pinker wrote a book. Its name is 'Enlightenment Now'.
He looks at the big picture of human progress. Progress is when things get better. He finds good news.
We live longer, healthier, freer, and happier lives.

But Pinker says there is a real problem. Enlightenment was a time when people started to think in new ways.
The ideas of reason and science from Enlightenment are in danger. Reason is good thinking. Science is studying facts.

Some people talk on TV or radio. Some bad leaders make people angry.
These people talk to others. They make people only like their own group. They make people think nothing can change. They make people not trust others.

Then we are in danger. We can cause problems that we cannot fix.
These problems can hurt important groups. These groups help people choose their leaders. These groups help countries work together.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Are things bad every day? Can things not get better?

Steven Pinker wrote a book. Its name is "Enlightenment Now". He looks at the whole story of humans. He says there is good news. He says humans are getting better.
We live longer. We are healthier. We are freer. We are happier.

But Pinker says there is a problem. He says people are attacking Enlightenment ideas. These ideas are about reason and science. The Enlightenment was a time when people started to think more about science and reason.

Some leaders and speakers talk to people. They make people only care about their own group. They make people think things cannot get better. They make people not trust others.
This can cause very bad damage. This damage cannot be fixed. This can hurt important groups. For example, it can hurt democracy. A democracy is when people choose their leaders. It can also hurt when countries work together.
